tn.text: Possible locations are 1) a place in Edom east of the Jordan river somewhere in modern western Jordan or 2) a place east of the Euphrates River in modern Iran. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The words "blameless" and "upright" share similar meanings and emphasize that Job was a righteous man. AT: "He did what was right before God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"one who honored God"
Here evil is spoken of as if it were a place that a person could avoid going to, instead of the doing of evil actions. AT: "refused to do evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"7 sons and 3 daughters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"He had 7,000 sheep"
"3,000 camels"
"500 pairs of oxen"
"the richest"

tn.ref: all the people of the East
tn.text: The refers to places that were east of Canaan. AT: "all the people who live in lands that were east of Canaan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: On each son's assigned day, he would give
tn.text: The word "day" perhaps refers to the day when they celebrated the son's birth. But it at least refers to the idea that the sons each took a turn in holding a feast. AT: "On each son's birthday, the son would give" or "Each son in turn would give"

tn.ref: he would give ... They would send ... Job would send ... he would consecrate ... He would rise early ... he would say
tn.text: "he habitually gave ... They habitually sent ... Job habitually sent ... he habitually consecrated ... He habitually rose early ... he habitually said"

Here "consecrate" means to ask God to take away any ritual impurities that Job's children might have brought upon themselves as they happily feasted together. Job did this by making sacrifices for them to God.
The word "them" refers to the seven sons and the three daughters but does not include Job.

tn.ref: When the days of the feast were over
tn.text: "When the feast was over" or "After the feast"
"Job habitually sent someone to call them to come to himself"
Often such thoughts could come unintentionally, without the person wanting to think them. AT: "cursed God in their thoughts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is not a specific day. The gathering happened often. AT: "at the time when" or "one day when"
This refers to angels, heavenly beings.
"to stand together before Yahweh as he commanded them to do"

tn.ref: From wandering on the earth, from going back and forth on it
tn.text: The phrases "wandering" and "going back and forth" refer to the same activity to emphasize its completeness. AT: "From going everywhere on the earth." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.

tn.ref: from going back and forth on it
tn.text: "back and forth" refers to traveling all over the earth. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: Have you considered my servant Job?
tn.text: "Have you thought about my servant Job?" Here God is beginning to talk with Satan about Job. "Consider my servant Job." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:job:01:01|1:1]].

tn.ref: one who fears God and turns from evil
tn.text: Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:job:01:01|1:1]].

tn.ref: Does Job fear God without reason?
tn.text: "Does Job respect God for no reason?" Satan responds to God by presenting and answering his own question. He says that Job obeys God only because God blesses him. AT: "Job has a reason for obeying God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Have you not put a barrier around him, around his house, and around all that is his from every side
tn.text: Satan states the facts to support his argument. AT: "You have protected him, his family and everything he owns." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: put a barrier around him, around his house
tn.text: Just as a barrier such as a wall or a hedge surrounds and protects one's land, God has surrounded Job with his protection. AT: "protected him and his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"everything that he does"

tn.ref: his cattle have burst forth in the land
tn.text: "he has more and more livestock in the land"

tn.ref: But now stretch out your hand and touch all that he has, and see if he does not curse you to your face
tn.text: Satan means that if God attacks Job, he will see how Job responds. AT: "But now, if you stretch out your hand and touch all that he has, you will see that he will curse you to your face"

tn.ref: But now stretch out your hand
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to God's power to act. "But now use your power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "touch" represents the action of harming or destroying. AT: "attack all that he has" or "destroy all that he has" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to a time when God is paying attention. AT: "in your hearing"
"Look" or "Pay attention to all that I am about to tell you"

tn.ref: all that he has is in your hand
tn.text: Here "hand" represents someone's power to control something. AT: "you have power over all that he has." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"against his body" AT: "but do not harm him physically" or "do not harm his body"

tn.ref: went away from the presence of Yahweh
tn.text: "departed from Yahweh" or "left Yahweh"

This was a region located in modern day Yemen. Here it represents a group of raiders or bandits from Sheba. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "fell" represents the idea of attacking. AT: "attacked them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here striking represents killing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "mouth" represents the part of swords that kill people, that is, either the point or the sharp edge. Also, all the swords of the men from Sheba are spoken of as if they were only one sword. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
"he" refers to the first messenger
"another messenger also came" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: I alone have escaped to tell you
tn.text: Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:job:01:13|01:15]].

tn.ref: As for the servants, they have struck them with the mouth of the sword. I alone have escaped to tell you
tn.text: Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:job:01:13|01:15]].

tn.ref: Your sons and your daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother's house
tn.text: Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:job:01:13|01:13]].
"a tornado" or "a desert storm"

tn.ref: the four corners of the house
tn.text: "the structural supports of the house"

tn.ref: It fell on the young people
tn.text: "The house fell on your sons and daughters"

tn.ref: I alone have escaped to tell you
tn.text: Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:job:01:13|01:15]].

tn.ref: tore his robe, shaved his head
tn.text: These were ritual mourning actions, symbolizing deep grief. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: It was naked that I out of my mother's womb, and it is naked that I will return there
tn.text: "At my birth, I brought nothing into the world, and at my death I will return to the earth with nothing."
"Regarding all this that happened"
"say that God had done wrong"
